column9: Initiative from the undisclosed GRI (found by the coder but not mentioned in the GRI index table)

column13: In 2023, we partnered with the Commonwealth Bank of Australia (CBA) in a pilot initiative to help protect customers by sharing SMS scam-related intelligence in near real-time. It allows us to block more scams from reaching customers while improving CBA's ability to disrupt, detect and proactively block fraudulent payments.

column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column7: If employees don't feel the options available to speak up are appropriate for your situation, they can report it using the Whistleblower process, including through our external Whistleblower hotline (Fair Call). Our Whistleblower hotline is a confidential and secure independent service where you can anonymously (if you choose) report a complaint, issue or concern relating to illegal, unethical or improper conduct.

In 2022, we collaborated on updating the 'Reducing Scam Calls and Scam SMS' industry code through the Communications Alliance. We reviewed our internal framework upon its release to confirm it met or exceeded the updated requirements.

column13: In 2020, TPG Telecom established the Fraud and Security Alliance Forum, a cross-industry forum bringing together banks, telcos, postal services, law enforcement, government agencies and regulators. The Forum works together to protect businesses and Australians from falling victim to scams through building partnerships, detection, prevention, and awareness programs. The Forum meets regularly and has continued to grow, with over 130 participants attending the most recent meeting.
column20: Fraud and Security Alliance Forum, Scam prevention, Industry collaboration

column13: We place a strong emphasis on meaningful stakeholder engagement. It is essential to our business objectives and helps us remain informed about our constantly evolving environment. It also keeps us in touch with the needs and expectations of those interested in or influencing our business and its performance.
column20: Stakeholder engagement, Business objectives, Environmental awareness

column13: In 2023, we launched our Supplier Engagement Program, marking a critical step towards embedding our sustainability commitments throughout our supply chain. This program focuses on critical areas where our suppliers can make a meaningful impact, including Energy & Emissions, Human Rights & Modern Slavery, Nature & Biodiversity, and Waste & the Circular Economy.
column20: Supplier Engagement Program, Supply chain sustainability, Impactful initiatives

column13: We remain committed to protecting Australians from financial harm and identity theft. In 2023, we focused on the following priorities: Supporting the National Anti-Scam Centre: TPG Telecom actively engages as a critical industry member, contributing to the Investment Scam and Communications & Awareness working groups. Advocating for a Verified Origin Registry: To combat alpha-tag impersonation SMS scams, we joined the ACMA SMS ID Registry pilot, aiming for more effective prevention of SMS scams that impersonate senders in text message headers. Collaboration through the Communications Alliance: Our involvement includes technical responses to call identifier number spoofing, incorporating SMS volume controls, limitations on the use of numbers allocated to TPG Telecom, and system improvements to disrupt and block scam calls and scam SMS on our network.

column7: In 2023, we undertook a double materiality review of the critical areas in our Sustainability Strategy. We evaluated the potential financial impact on the business (financial materiality) and the potential environmental and social impact on our stakeholders (impact materiality). We used this review to prioritise the coverage within our Annual and Sustainability Reports and to help prepare for upcoming mandatory disclosure requirements.\t
Environmental responsibility, Customer wellbeing, Inclusion and belonging, Digital economy, Responsible Business Practices

column13: Our analysis led to a change in our Strategic Leadership methodology. In 2022, this calculation included Executives, General Managers, and their direct reports. However, we identified this method inadvertently included some roles that needed to align with the definition of a strategic leader in TPG Telecom. As a result, we have adjusted our calculation method to better align with our target's intent. Our revised methodology now uses our internal job grading system, grouping the three senior leadership levels below the CEO (grades 2-4), all with strategic decision-making responsibilities.

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column13: This technology uses a high-frequency spectrum, enabling it to carry large amounts of data over short distances. It is well-suited for high-traffic areas, like significant transport hubs or sporting stadiums, where many people use the mobile network simultaneously. The ultra-high- bandwidth capability of 5G mmWave enables the use of data-intensive applications, such as 8K video streaming and immersive virtual or augmented reality experiences.

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column13: In 2023, we successfully migrated our consumer and business 4G and 5G data services onto Ericsson's single, consolidated Dual Mode Core network. This move increases our network's operational efficiency, enabling the delivery of new services. It also paves the way for faster and more frequent software upgrades to keep TPG Telecom's mobile network stable and secure. This move provides a platform to better support the ever-increasing customer demand for data while laying the foundations for future mobile use cases for consumer and enterprise needs.
column20: Network migration, Operational efficiency, Software upgrades

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column13: Partnering with Cisco, TPG Telecom deployed a new networking technology called SRv6. This technology helps our network more efficiently manage and direct traffic over our 5G and fixed-line networks, allowing us to deliver an improved customer experience through better service performance. Implementing SRv6 enables the potential for faster, demand-driven, high-quality, low-latency connectivity services for 5G, cloud computing and IoT applications.
column20: Networking technology, Traffic management, Service performance

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column7: TPG Telecom addresses climate change and its effects by identifying and managing risks and opportunities as we transition to a low-carbon economy. Understanding the impact of climate change and climate-related events over the coming decades will help inform future business decisions relating to our operations and value chain.

column8: Commonwealth Government's Mobile Black Spot Program
column13: We continue participating in various state and federal-supported initiatives to improve resilience and network capability. In recent years, we completed a significant program to build mobile base stations across Australia through the Commonwealth Government's Mobile Black Spot Program.
column20: GHG emissions reduction, Renewable electricity, Carbon neutrality

column8: Strengthening Telecommunications Against Natural Disasters (STAND) program
column13: As part of the Strengthening Telecommunications Against Natural Disasters (STAND) program, which aims to improve the resilience of Australia's telecommunications networks in bushfire and disaster-prone areas, we upgraded battery backups on mobile black spot sites. We also built temporary portable coverage and power solutions, which are ready to be rapidly deployed to sites impacted by natural disasters.\t
column20: GHG emissions reduction, Targets, Long-term commitments

column7: Our ongoing efforts will allow us to continue simplifying our plans and products. This will provide us with a clear consumer and business focus as we move to fewer brands with simplified offers, making it easier for our customers to access and use our services.

column6: Proportion of spending on local suppliers
column7: While most of our procurement spend is with vendors based in Australia, we acknowledge that our direct suppliers often have offshore manufacturing operations and their tiers of domestic and international suppliers. It results in a deep, complex supply chain that comprises many tiers.

column6: Operations assessed for risks related to corruption
column7: The Company has an Anti-Bribery & Anti-Corruption Policy that prohibits directors, officers, employees, contractors and any other associated persons from engaging in activity that constitutes bribery or corruption and provides guidelines for what constitutes bribery or corruption. Material incidents reported under the Anti-Bribery & Anti-Corruption Policy are immediately escalated to the Board's attention as appropriate and by the Company's internal reporting processes.

Tax governance, control, and risk management
column7: For tax purposes, from 13 July 2020, the wholly owned Australian subsidiaries acquired as part of the merger with TPG Corporation entered the tax consolidated group, of which the Company is the head entity, by Australian taxation law. The tax sharing agreement between the entities within the tax consolidated group determines the allocation of the income tax liabilities between entities should the head entity default in its tax payment obligations or if an entity should leave the group. The effect of the tax sharing agreement is that the Company's liability for tax payable by the tax consolidated group is limited to the amount payable to the head entity under the tax funding arrangement.

column6: Stakeholder engagement and management of concerns related to tax
Materials used by weight or volume

column7: Our EcoSIMs are made from 100 percent recycled plastic and are certified carbon neutral. They feature a sleeve made from 100 percent recycled cardboard. eSIMs, now available across all of our major brands, do not have a physical component, meaning less plastic waste from manufacturing and packaging and reduced energy and emissions related to transport and manufacturing requirements.
